activities.title: Texposium 1.0 - Poster Presentation Competition
activities.excerpt: AATCC-AUST Student Chapter hosted Texposium 1.0, a vibrant poster presentation competition bringing together ten teams to showcase innovative textile research and designs.
activities.description:
The AATCC-AUST Student Chapter proudly hosted Texposium 1.0 at the AUST campus, marking a milestone event in the textile education landscape of Bangladesh. This inaugural poster presentation competition brought together the brightest minds passionate about textiles, fostering an environment of creativity, innovation, and academic excellence. The event represented a significant step forward in promoting research and development among students in the textile sector.

Texposium 1.0 was made possible through the generous support of distinguished sponsors. Techno Colour Craft Limited served as the Title Sponsor, while MTM Intending joined as the Co-Sponsor, demonstrating the industry's commitment to nurturing young textile talent. Their support enabled the chapter to create a professional platform where students could showcase their research and innovative ideas.

A total of ten enthusiastic teams participated in the competition, each presenting their unique projects and designs with remarkable creativity and technical insight. The poster presentations covered a diverse range of topics including textile science fundamentals, sustainable textile practices, innovative material applications, and cutting-edge design concepts. Each team's work highlighted different perspectives on how textiles can address contemporary challenges and opportunities in the industry, creating a comprehensive showcase of knowledge and inspiration.

The judging process was conducted by an esteemed panel composed of AUST faculty members, who brought their extensive expertise to evaluate the submissions. The evaluation criteria focused on four key areas: originality of concept, clarity of presentation, relevance to current textile industry needs, and overall impact of the proposed work. The rigorous deliberations reflected the high standard of submissions received, with judges carefully assessing each presentation to identify the most outstanding contributions to textile research and innovation.

The competition recognized excellence through prize money awards for top-performing teams, acknowledging their hard work and dedication while encouraging further exploration in the field of textiles. Participants expressed tremendous excitement at the opportunity to showcase their ideas in a professional setting, gaining valuable experience in academic presentation and professional communication. Faculty members appreciated the event as an invaluable platform to identify and nurture young talent, bridging the gap between classroom learning and industry expectations.

Beyond the competition itself, Texposium 1.0 facilitated meaningful dialogue between students and textile experts, creating opportunities for knowledge exchange and mentorship. The event emphasized not only technical skill and creativity but also essential professional competencies including teamwork, presentation skills, and the ability to communicate complex ideas effectively. These soft skills are crucial for career development in the textile industry and related fields.

The success of Texposium 1.0 carries special significance as AATCC-AUST Student Chapter proudly holds the distinction of being AATCC's first Student Chapter in Bangladesh and second in South Asia. This prestigious position comes with both honor and responsibility, motivating the organizing team to continue working diligently for the advancement of textile education and industry development in the region.

The event underscores the growing commitment of AATCC-AUST Student Chapter to empower students, promote innovation, and contribute meaningfully to the future of the textile industry in Bangladesh. The organizers extended heartfelt thanks to the judges, participants, and sponsors for their invaluable support, recognizing that events like Texposium play a crucial role in shaping the next generation of textile professionals. The chapter looks forward to building on this success with future editions, continuing to provide platforms for student innovation and excellence in textile education.

activities.title: AATCC Student Chapter's Visit to RH Corporation
activities.excerpt: AATCC Student Chapter explored RH Corporation's state-of-the-art textile manufacturing facilities, gaining insights into sustainable chemical processes, advanced dyeing and printing units, and quality control systems.
activities.description:
In a remarkable step forward for experiential learning, the AATCC Student Chapter had the privilege of visiting RH Corporation, one of Bangladesh's leading names in textile manufacturing, specializing in sustainable chemicals and dyes, machines, and auxiliaries. This industrial visit provided students with an invaluable opportunity to witness firsthand how theoretical knowledge translates into practical industrial applications.

The visit opened doors to a deeper understanding of RH Corporation's cutting-edge production facilities and innovative fabric development techniques. Students were guided through various departments, each showcasing the company's commitment to technological advancement and operational excellence. The comprehensive tour covered multiple aspects of textile manufacturing, from raw material processing to finished product quality assurance.

One of the highlights of the visit was exploring the advanced dyeing, washing, and printing units. Students observed the sophisticated machinery and automated processes that enable RH Corporation to maintain consistency and precision in their operations. The dyeing units demonstrated various techniques for achieving vibrant, long-lasting colors while adhering to environmental standards. The washing and printing sections revealed the intricate steps involved in fabric finishing and pattern application, utilizing state-of-the-art technology.

RH Corporation's dedication to sustainable manufacturing practices particularly impressed the visiting students. The facility showcased numerous initiatives aimed at reducing environmental impact, including water recycling systems, energy-efficient machinery, and eco-friendly chemical alternatives. This emphasis on sustainability aligned perfectly with the growing global demand for responsible textile production and provided students with insights into how industry leaders are addressing environmental challenges.

The strict quality control processes implemented throughout the production chain demonstrated RH Corporation's unwavering commitment to excellence. Students learned about various testing procedures, quality checkpoints, and certification standards that ensure every product meets international specifications. From fiber testing to colorfastness evaluation, the quality assurance protocols revealed the meticulous attention to detail required in professional textile manufacturing.

Every corner of RH Corporation reflected innovation and forward-thinking approaches to textile production. The experience allowed students to bridge their classroom knowledge with real-world industrial expertise, creating connections between academic concepts and practical applications. Many students expressed that seeing these processes in action solidified their understanding of textile chemistry, machinery operations, and production management.

The visit proved to be an inspiring experience that motivated students to aim higher in their own research and professional journeys. Exposure to such a well-established industry player provided clarity on career pathways and the skills needed to excel in the textile sector. Students gained practical knowledge about industry standards, workplace dynamics, and the technological competencies required in modern textile manufacturing.

The AATCC Student Chapter extends sincere gratitude to RH Corporation for their warm welcome, valuable insights, and generous hospitality. Special thanks to the management and staff who took time to explain processes, answer questions, and share their expertise with the visiting students. This visit has given students a glimpse into the future of textile manufacturing and reinforced the importance of continuous learning and industry engagement in their academic journey.

activities.title: Unlocking Opportunities: The Importance of Research for Postgraduate Success in Textiles
activities.excerpt: An exclusive academic webinar exploring the strategic role of research in postgraduate success and career advancement in the global textile sector, led by Dr. Abu Sadat Muhammad Sayem from Manchester Metropolitan University.
activities.description:
The AATCC AUST Student Chapter proudly presented an exclusive academic webinar titled "Unlocking Opportunities: The Importance of Research for Postgraduate Success in Textiles" on May 18, 2025. This specialized session was designed to illuminate the critical role that academic research plays in shaping successful postgraduate trajectories and advancing careers within the competitive global textile industry.

The webinar featured Dr. Abu Sadat Muhammad Sayem, a distinguished academic professional serving as Project Lead for the AHRC Digital Fashion Network at Manchester Metropolitan University and Editor of the Textile Institute Professional Publication Series. Dr. Sayem brought extensive expertise and international perspective to the discussion, offering invaluable insights into how research serves as a foundation for innovation, global collaboration, and leadership development in textile sciences.

During this comprehensive session, participants gained in-depth understanding of research methodologies, publication strategies, and the pathways through which academic research translates into career opportunities. The webinar covered essential topics including identifying research opportunities, developing research proposals, navigating the publication process, and leveraging research experience for postgraduate admissions and fellowship applications. Dr. Sayem also shared practical advice on building research portfolios and establishing professional networks within the international textile research community.

The session was strategically scheduled at 9:00 PM BST to accommodate participants across different time zones and was conducted via Google Meet platform, ensuring seamless digital participation. The interactive format allowed members to engage directly with Dr. Sayem, asking questions about research challenges, postgraduate program selection, and career development strategies specific to the textile sector.

This webinar represented a significant learning opportunity for AATCC AUST Student Chapter members aspiring to pursue higher education, research fellowships, or global textile careers. By understanding research as a catalyst for innovation and professional growth, participants were better equipped to make informed decisions about their academic and career pathways. The session particularly benefited undergraduate students planning for master's or doctoral studies, as well as those interested in research-oriented careers in textile technology, fashion innovation, and sustainable textile development.

Access to this exclusive webinar was restricted to verified AATCC AUST Student Chapter members only, reinforcing the value of active membership. Registered members received the webinar link directly through their provided email addresses, ensuring secure and organized participation. The chapter remains committed to organizing such high-impact academic sessions that connect members with global experts and provide strategic guidance for professional advancement in the textile industry.

The AATCC AUST Student Chapter extends sincere gratitude to Dr. Abu Sadat Muhammad Sayem for sharing his expertise and to all participating members for their enthusiastic engagement. This webinar exemplifies the chapter's dedication to fostering academic excellence, research culture, and global networking opportunities for textile students at Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology.

activities.title: Idea to Impact: Mastering Project Work & Research Writing
activities.excerpt: A comprehensive workshop led by Dr. Mohammad Tajul Islam, providing essential guidance on research methodologies, project execution, and academic writing skills for students' academic and professional success.
activities.description:
The AATCC AUST Student Chapter successfully organized an enriching workshop titled "Idea to Impact: Mastering Project Work & Research Writing" on February 5, 2025. This highly anticipated session was designed to equip students with fundamental skills in research methodology, project management, and academic writing—competencies essential for both academic excellence and professional career development in the textile and engineering fields.

The workshop was expertly conducted by Dr. Mohammad Tajul Islam, a distinguished faculty member whose extensive experience in research and academic writing provided participants with practical, actionable insights. Dr. Islam's comprehensive approach covered the complete research journey, from conceptualizing innovative ideas to transforming them into impactful projects and scholarly publications. His teaching methodology combined theoretical frameworks with real-world applications, making complex concepts accessible and immediately applicable for students at various academic levels.

Throughout the session, participants engaged with key topics including effective research design, literature review strategies, data collection and analysis techniques, and the fundamentals of academic writing. Dr. Islam emphasized the importance of structured project execution, demonstrating how to develop clear research questions, formulate hypotheses, and design methodologies that yield meaningful results. Special attention was given to common pitfalls in research writing and how to avoid them, including issues related to plagiarism, proper citation practices, and maintaining academic integrity.

The workshop also addressed practical aspects of project work, including time management, resource allocation, and collaborative research practices. Participants learned how to effectively document their research processes, present findings professionally, and prepare manuscripts for academic journals and conferences. Dr. Islam shared valuable tips on structuring research papers, crafting compelling abstracts, and communicating technical information clearly and concisely—skills that are increasingly important in today's competitive academic and industrial landscapes.

The interactive format of the workshop encouraged active participation, with students asking questions about their specific research challenges and receiving personalized guidance. Many participants expressed appreciation for the practical examples and case studies shared during the session, which helped them understand how theoretical concepts translate into successful research outcomes. The engaging atmosphere fostered collaborative learning, with students sharing their own experiences and learning from their peers' challenges and successes.

This workshop represents a significant step in the AATCC AUST Student Chapter's commitment to academic development and research culture cultivation among textile engineering students. By providing access to such high-quality educational resources and expert mentorship, the chapter continues to support students in developing the critical thinking and technical writing skills necessary for pursuing higher education, publishing research papers, and excelling in research-intensive career paths within the textile industry.

The AATCC AUST Student Chapter extends heartfelt gratitude to Dr. Mohammad Tajul Islam for his invaluable contribution and for generously sharing his expertise with the student community. Special thanks are also due to all participants whose enthusiastic engagement and thoughtful questions made the session truly interactive and productive. The chapter remains dedicated to organizing more such enriching academic sessions that empower students with the knowledge and skills needed to transform their innovative ideas into meaningful impact in the textile sector and beyond.

activities.title: AATCC Student Chapter's First Lab Visit to Intertek
activities.excerpt: A landmark industrial visit to Intertek's advanced textile testing facilities, where students explored cutting-edge testing methodologies and connected theoretical knowledge with real-world industry applications.
activities.description:
In an exciting milestone for the newly formed AATCC AUST Student Chapter, members embarked on their inaugural industrial visit to Intertek, a prestigious golden member of AATCC, on October 2, 2024. This pioneering visit marked a significant step in the chapter's journey to bridge academic learning with practical industry exposure, providing students with invaluable insights into professional textile testing and quality assurance operations.

Intertek, a globally recognized leader in quality and safety solutions, opened its doors to showcase its state-of-the-art textile testing facilities. During the comprehensive tour, students were introduced to advanced testing equipment and methodologies used to evaluate all aspects of textile product processing—from fiber analysis and fabric construction to colorfastness, dimensional stability, and performance testing. The visit provided an in-depth understanding of how international testing standards are applied in real-world scenarios to ensure product quality, safety, and compliance with regulatory requirements.

The facility tour demonstrated Intertek's expertise across multiple testing domains, including physical testing, chemical analysis, and environmental assessment of textile materials. Students witnessed firsthand how sophisticated instruments measure fabric strength, abrasion resistance, pilling propensity, and other critical quality parameters. Industry professionals at Intertek explained the importance of rigorous testing protocols in maintaining global supply chain integrity and protecting consumer interests, emphasizing how these practices directly impact brand reputation and market success in the competitive textile industry.

One of the most fascinating aspects of the visit was learning about Intertek's diverse service portfolio that extends far beyond textiles. As highlighted during the session, Intertek's global reach encompasses multiple industries—from inspecting millions of dollars worth of gold bars every fortnight for the mining industry to providing assurance services across food, chemicals, construction, and consumer goods sectors. This revelation truly embodied their compelling motto: "You'll be amazed where you find Intertek," illustrating the company's expansive influence across numerous industrial sectors worldwide.

For students, this visit served as a crucial learning experience that connected classroom theories with practical industry applications. Many participants expressed appreciation for the opportunity to see how concepts learned in textile testing courses are implemented in professional laboratory settings. The exposure to industry-standard equipment, testing procedures, and quality management systems provided students with realistic career insights and helped them understand the practical skills required to excel in textile testing and quality assurance roles.

The visit also fostered meaningful interactions between students and industry professionals, creating networking opportunities that could prove valuable for future internships, projects, and career placements. Intertek representatives shared insights about career pathways in textile testing, quality control, and certification services, inspiring students to consider diverse opportunities within the broader quality assurance ecosystem. The experience reinforced the importance of precision, attention to detail, and adherence to international standards—qualities essential for success in the textile industry.

The AATCC AUST Student Chapter extends heartfelt gratitude to Intertek for their warm hospitality, generosity in sharing knowledge, and commitment to supporting student education. Special thanks to the Intertek team for organizing this enriching experience and for their dedication to nurturing the next generation of textile professionals. This successful inaugural visit has set a strong foundation for future industry collaborations and established a valuable partnership that will continue to benefit AATCC AUST Student Chapter members in their academic and professional development journeys.
